definitions: unworked stone found in fields used for building walls and foundations
examples: The old farmhouse featured a beautiful fieldstone foundation
They gathered fieldstone from the property to build the garden wall

definitions: practical work conducted by researchers in natural environments outside laboratories
temporary fortification constructed by troops in field positions during military operations
examples: The anthropologist spent months doing fieldwork in remote villages
Her fieldwork data provided valuable insights into local customs
The soldiers constructed defensive fieldwork along the ridge
Military engineers supervised the fieldwork construction before the battle

definitions: wicked or cruel person often associated with demonic or supernatural evil
person who is extremely enthusiastic about or addicted to something specific
examples: The villain in the story was portrayed as a ruthless fiend
Medieval tales often featured fiends tormenting innocent souls
She's a complete fitness fiend who works out twice daily
My neighbor is a coffee fiend who drinks six cups daily

definitions: religious festival or celebration especially in Spanish-speaking cultures featuring music and dancing
examples: The town's annual fiesta attracts thousands of visitors each summer
During the fiesta, streets filled with music and colorful decorations

definitions: small high-pitched transverse flute commonly used in military and folk music
examples: The marching band included drummers and fife players
He learned to play the fife in the Revolutionary War reenactment group

definitions: cardinal number between fourteen and sixteen representing this quantity
examples: The meeting is scheduled to last fifteen minutes
She bought fifteen apples at the farmer's market

definitions: ordinal number indicating position fifteen in a sequence or series
examples: Her birthday falls on the fifteenth of March
The fifteenth amendment granted voting rights regardless of race

definitions: ordinal number indicating position five in a sequence
interval spanning five consecutive notes in a musical scale
bottle containing one fifth of a gallon typically for distilled spirits
examples: She finished fifth in the marathon race
The fifth chapter explains the main theory
The perfect fifth creates a harmonious sound
Practice playing fifths to improve your technique
He bought a fifth of whiskey for the party
The store only had fifths, not quarts available

definitions: ordinal number indicating position fifty in a sequence or series
examples: They celebrated their fiftieth wedding anniversary with family
The fiftieth percentile represents the median value

definitions: cardinal number between forty-nine and fifty-one representing this quantity
examples: The speed limit here is fifty miles per hour
She invited fifty guests to her retirement party

definitions: soft sweet fruit with many seeds growing on ficus trees
something of little or no value used in negative expressions
examples: Fresh figs are delicious with cheese and honey
The ancient fig tree still produces fruit every summer
I don't give a fig what they think about me
Their opinion isn't worth a fig to the committee

definitions: violent confrontation or physical struggle between people or groups
vigorous campaign or struggle to achieve or resist something
examples: The fight broke out after the controversial referee decision
Security quickly intervened to stop the fight between fans
Her fight against cancer inspired everyone who knew her
The fight for civil rights continued through many decades

definitions: person who fights especially as a sport or profession
fast military aircraft designed primarily for attacking other aircraft
examples: The professional fighter trains six hours every day
She's a fighter who never gives up despite challenges
The fighter jet performed spectacular maneuvers at the airshow
Modern fighters can exceed twice the speed of sound

definitions: act of engaging in physical combat or violent confrontation between parties
examples: Heavy fighting continued throughout the night near the border
The referee warned both players about excessive fighting

definitions: something that exists only in imagination and has no objective reality
examples: The monster was just a figment of the child's imagination
His elaborate story turned out to be a complete figment

definitions: act or process of forming something into a particular shape or figure
decorative treatment using patterns, designs, or representational elements
examples: The artist's figuration technique created striking abstract forms
Symbolic figuration appears throughout the medieval manuscript
The baroque ceiling featured elaborate figuration in gold leaf
Musical figuration adds complexity to the simple melody

definitions: number or amount expressed in numerical form
shape or form of a person's body especially regarding attractiveness
person of particular importance or notable characteristics in some sphere
diagram, drawing, or decorative design illustrating textual material
examples: The sales figures exceeded our quarterly projections significantly
Please check these figures before submitting the report
She maintains her figure through regular exercise and healthy eating
The dress perfectly complemented her tall slender figure
He became a prominent figure in the civil rights movement
Several public figures attended the charity gala last night
Refer to figure 3 for the molecular structure diagram
The textbook includes helpful figures explaining each concept

definitions: person holding a position of leadership but having no real power or authority
carved ornamental figure attached to the prow of a sailing ship
examples: The president became merely a figurehead while generals controlled the government
The board wanted a figurehead CEO while they retained actual control
The maritime museum displays several restored figureheads from historic vessels
The ship's figurehead depicted a mythical sea goddess

definitions: small ornamental statuette representing a human, deity, or animal form
examples: She collects porcelain figurines from different European countries
The ancient figurine was discovered during the archaeological excavation

definitions: process of calculating, working out, or determining something through reasoning
examples: The figuring of complex equations requires careful attention to detail
After much figuring, they determined the project's total cost

definitions: very thin threadlike structure or fiber especially in living organisms
thin wire in an incandescent light bulb that glows when heated
examples: The spider's web consists of incredibly strong protein filaments
Muscle tissue contains numerous contractile filaments
The tungsten filament glowed brightly inside the vintage bulb
When the filament breaks, the light bulb stops working

definitions: cultivated hazelnut tree or its edible nut with a husk
examples: Chocolate-covered filberts make a delicious holiday treat
The orchard grows both walnuts and filberts commercially

definitions: folder or container for storing documents or computer data systematically
tool with roughened surface used for smoothing or shaping hard materials
line of people or things arranged one behind another
examples: Please save the document in the project file
The lawyer organized evidence into separate case files
Use a metal file to smooth the rough edges
She filed her nails with an emery file
Students walked in single file to the assembly hall
The soldiers marched in file through the narrow passage

definitions: identifying name given to a computer file stored in a file system
examples: The filename must not contain special characters or spaces
Please change the filename to something more descriptive

definitions: prolonged speech or series of speeches made to delay legislative action in parliament
examples: The senator's filibuster lasted for over twenty-four hours straight
Opposition members threatened to filibuster the controversial bill

definitions: delicate ornamental work of fine wire especially in gold or silver jewelry
examples: The antique brooch featured intricate silver filigree patterns
Master jewelers spent months creating the filigree wedding crown

definitions: act of officially submitting documents to authorities or organizing them systematically
small particles produced by using a file on metal or other materials
examples: The filing deadline for tax returns is April fifteenth
Proper filing systems improve office efficiency significantly
Iron filings can demonstrate magnetic field patterns clearly
The mechanic swept up the metal filings from the workshop floor

definitions: amount needed to make something full or complete to capacity
examples: She had her fill of excitement after the roller coaster ride
The tank needs another gallon to reach its fill

definitions: substance used to fill gaps, cracks, or cavities in surfaces
content added to extend length without adding significant value or meaning
examples: Apply wood filler to the holes before painting the cabinet
The dentist used composite filler to repair the cavity
The article contained too much filler and little substance
Most of the album tracks seemed like filler material

definitions: piece of meat or fish with bones removed prepared for cooking
narrow flat band or strip used as architectural or decorative element
examples: The chef prepared salmon fillet with lemon butter sauce
She ordered the chicken fillet sandwich for lunch
The column featured a decorative fillet around its base
A gold fillet adorned the edge of the picture frame

definitions: material used to fill a tooth cavity or repair dental damage
mixture of ingredients used as stuffing inside pastries, sandwiches, or other foods
examples: The dentist replaced her old silver filling with composite material
The filling lasted twenty years before needing replacement
The pie's apple filling was perfectly spiced with cinnamon
Choose your sandwich filling from the menu options

definitions: female horse under four years old that has not yet been bred
examples: The spirited filly won her first race at Churchill Downs
They bought a promising filly at the yearling auction

definitions: series of moving images that tells a story shown in theaters or on screens
thin flexible sheet or layer of material covering a surface
light-sensitive material used in photography before digital technology
examples: The film won three awards at the international festival
They're watching a classic film from the 1940s tonight
A thin film of oil covered the water's surface
Remove the protective film before using the screen
She still prefers film photography over digital cameras
The photographer loaded fresh film into the vintage camera

definitions: process of recording moving images for a film or video production
examples: Filming begins next month on location in New Zealand
The filming schedule requires twelve weeks to complete

definitions: person who directs or produces films as a creative profession
examples: The independent filmmaker premiered her documentary at Sundance
Young filmmakers often start with short films

definitions: device that removes unwanted elements from substances passing through it
feature or criterion that selectively includes or excludes certain items
examples: Change the air filter in your car every twelve thousand miles
The water filter removes chlorine and other impurities
Apply a search filter to find specific results
The hiring filter eliminated unqualified candidates

definitions: disgusting dirt or refuse that is extremely unclean or contaminated
obscene or offensive material considered morally corrupting
examples: The abandoned building was covered in years of accumulated filth
They spent hours cleaning the filth from the neglected barn
The committee voted to ban what they considered filth from libraries
Some critics called the movie absolute filth

definitions: process of passing liquid or gas through a filter to remove impurities
examples: The water undergoes multiple stages of filtration before bottling
Proper filtration extends the life of industrial equipment

definitions: flattened appendage on fish used for propulsion and steering in water
projecting surface on aircraft, rockets, or surfboards for stability
examples: The shark's dorsal fin broke the water's surface
Tropical fish often have brightly colored fins
The rocket's fins provide stability during flight
He attached larger fins to improve the surfboard's control

definitions: last game or match in a tournament determining the winner
comprehensive examination at the end of an academic course or term
examples: The team advanced to the championship final after defeating their rivals
Millions watched the World Cup final on television
She studied all weekend for her chemistry final
Final exams account for forty percent of the course grade

definitions: last part of a musical composition, entertainment, or public event
examples: The symphony's finale brought the audience to their feet
Fireworks marked the grand finale of the celebration

definitions: competitor who has reached the final stage of a competition
examples: The three finalists will present their projects next week
She was a finalist in the national spelling bee

definitions: quality of being final, settled, and impossible to change or reverse
examples: The judge spoke with finality about the court's decision
There was a sense of finality when she closed the door

definitions: act of completing or making final the last details of something
examples: The contract finalization took longer than expected
We're awaiting finalization of the merger agreement

definitions: management of money, banking, investments, and credit
monetary resources and funding available for spending
examples: She studied finance at the university business school
The finance department oversees all company investments
The project requires significant finance to move forward
They secured finance through venture capital investors

definitions: person who manages or provides large amounts of money for business ventures
examples: The wealthy financier invested in several startup companies
Wall Street financiers met to discuss the market crisis

definitions: act of providing funds for business activities, purchases, or investments
examples: The startup secured financing from angel investors
They offer attractive financing options for new car buyers

definitions: small seed-eating songbird with a short thick beak and colorful plumage
examples: Goldfinches visited the backyard feeder every morning
Darwin studied finches to understand evolution

definitions: something that has been found or discovered especially by chance
valuable or interesting discovery considered particularly fortunate or significant
examples: The archaeological find dates back three thousand years
Her latest find at the antique market was remarkable
That restaurant is a real find in this neighborhood
The young actress was the director's greatest find

definitions: person who finds someone or something especially professionally
device or system that helps locate or identify objects
examples: The finder received a reward for returning the lost wallet
Professional finders help locate missing heirs
Use the viewfinder to frame your photograph properly
The star finder helps astronomers locate celestial objects
